akn:section.akn:heading: National Fund for Excellence in American Indian Education

akn:content.akn:p:
§ 5421. National Fund for Excellence in American Indian Education(a) In generalAs soon as practicable after December 27, 2000, the Secretary of the Interior shall establish, under the laws of the District of Columbia and in accordance with this subchapter, a foundation to be known as the “National Fund for Excellence in American Indian Education” (hereinafter referred to as the “Foundation”).
(b) Perpetual existenceExcept as otherwise provided, the Foundation shall have perpetual existence.
(c) Nature of corporationThe Foundation shall be a charitable and nonprofit federally chartered corporation and shall not be an agency or instrumentality of the United States.
(d) Place of incorporation and domicileThe Foundation shall be incorporated and domiciled in the District of Columbia.
(e) PurposesThe purposes of the Foundation shall be—(1) to encourage, accept, and administer private gifts of real and personal property or any income therefrom or other interest therein for the benefit of, or in support of, the mission of the Office of Indian Education Programs of the Bureau of Indian Affairs (or its successor office);
(2) to undertake and conduct such other activities as will further the educational opportunities of American Indians who attend a Bureau funded school; and
(3) to participate with, and otherwise assist, Federal, State, and tribal governments, agencies, entities, and individuals in undertaking and conducting activities that will further the educational opportunities of American Indians attending Bureau funded schools.
(f) Board of Directors(1) In generalThe Board of Directors shall be the governing body of the Foundation. The Board may exercise, or provide for the exercise of, the powers of the Foundation.
